analyzed: rāja puttaḥ yudhañjayaḥ  ussāva bindum sūriya ātape
translated: son of a king, of boundless fame,🔽seeing a drop of dew fall
in the sun’s rays, I was inspired.
I asked for the going forth.
The people of the country and the kingdom,
with hands raised in salutation, asked me:
to the great kingdom of prosperity and growth.’
The king, my relatives,🔽the people of the country and the kingdom,
I cast away without a thought,
only for the sake of Awakening.
My parents were not dear to me,
therefore I gave up the kingdom.”
The Story of Yudhañjaya, the first.
